page.title: 16OLDER PEOPLE IN LONGSTANTON
page.content: About 120 Longstanton residents are{pensioners.}Many have lived here a long while, but a few have arrived only since retirement. There are certain{problems}for old people here. Suitable houses are scarce, and expensive. Without a car, shopping facilities are limited, and the local shops are dearer than the supermarkets. The nearest doctor is at Willingham; and those attending morning surgery have no return bus till afternoon. An active{Over-60s group meets on alternate Thursday afternoons. Sometimes there are visiting speakers, sometimes outings. An average attendance is 35. There are 18{Old People's flats, Warden-controlled and run by the County Council, and 6 more are to be built. There is a long waiting list.
